title: Newton woman facing assault, kidnapping, other charges around alleged unlicensed cosmetic surgery in Allston
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Dingrui Wang, 34, faces multiple charges including assault and kidnapping after performing alleged illegal cosmetic surgery in Allston.
Wang allegedly posed as a physician and conducted a procedure causing permanent damage using non-FDA-approved fillers.
Wang is accused of misrepresenting her credentials to obtain $37,379 in loans, claiming suspended licenses as active.

title: Car rammed by train in Abington after breaking down on tracks
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A 2007 Honda broke down on tracks and was hit by an MBTA train in Abington.
The incident occurred around 8 p.m. near Plymouth St., but no injuries were reported.
The car was unoccupied at the time of the collision; the 35-year-old driver had left the area.

title: Woman, 57, walking in road due to snow hit and killed by car on Route 28 in Wareham, DA says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: A 57-year-old woman died after being struck by a Volvo on Route 28 in Wareham, officials said.
The pedestrians were walking in the road due to snow-covered sidewalks when they were hit Sunday night.
Plymouth DA's office states the Volvo driver was not speeding or distracted; the investigation is ongoing.

title: Former North Shore police officer gets prison time for child porn charge
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Alexander Aiello, former Gloucester officer, sentenced to four years for receiving child pornography.
Police found hundreds of abuse files on Aiello's encrypted thumb drive during an April 2025 search.
Aiello accessed a child pornography site several times from 2024 to 2025, using Tor Browser for anonymity.

title: ‘The finest kind’: Gloucester mourns 7 lost in Lily Jean sinking as Coast Guard launches probe
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Seven crew members of the fishing boat Lily Jean are presumed dead after it sank off Gloucester, Massachusetts.
The U.S. Coast Guard has launched an investigation into the sinking, alongside the National Transportation Safety Board.
Captain Accursio Sanfilippo and his team were recognized for their dedication to the sea, termed the 'finest kind.'

title: Why readers think Bill Belichick belonged in the Hall of Fame this year
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Bill Belichick missed first-ballot induction into the Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2026.
93% of over 450 Boston.com readers felt Belichick deserved Hall of Fame induction this year.
Readers cited both Belichick's successful NFL coaching tenure and scandals as factors in the vote.

title: Which Patriots Super Bowl will you never forget?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Boston.com invites readers to share their unforgettable New England Patriots Super Bowl moments, both on and off the field.
Iconic plays like Adam Vinatieri's game-winning field goal and Malcolm Butler's interception highlight Patriots Super Bowl history.
Fans can submit their stories of memorable Super Bowl experiences to possibly feature in a future Boston.com article.

title: This runner is raising awareness about stroke and heart disease
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Liz Lang, 48, from Jackson, NJ, runs the 2026 Boston Marathon to raise awareness about stroke and heart disease.
Lang's commitment to health began after a 2006 heart arrhythmia diagnosis, leading to lifestyle changes and improved heart health.
She fundraises for Tedy's Team, advocating for self-care and supporting research on stroke and heart disease prevention.

title: Once a patient, now a runner: She’s running for Boston Children’s Hospital
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Molly Kokoski, 26, is running the Boston Marathon to raise funds for Boston Children's Hospital.
Kokoski was treated for ulcerative colitis at the hospital, leading to her lifelong use of an ostomy bag.
Inspired by the marathon's energy, Kokoski aims to demonstrate that an ostomy bag doesn't limit her abilities.

title: Saks OFF 5th to close Massachusetts stores
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Saks Global is closing its Saks OFF 5th locations in Somerville and Wrentham following its bankruptcy filing.
Only 12 Saks OFF 5th stores will remain operational to sell inventory from Saks Fifth Avenue, Neiman Marcus, and Bergdorf Goodman.
Saks Global secured $1.75 billion in financing to restructure after heavy debt from acquiring Neiman Marcus.
